item.title: Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires
item.description:
Guarding Against Chernobyl's Radioactive Forest Fires

Thirty years after the Chernobyl disaster, firefighters remain on high alert to prevent radioactive forest fires. Originally published at - http://www.rferl.org/media/video/guarding-against-chernobyls-radioactive-forest-fires/27691519.html

item.description:
A Turning Point for China?

In this film, William Nee discusses what it's like doing human rights work in China today, and tells the story of Pu Zhiqiang, one of China's most famous fre...

item.title: Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square
item.description:
Masked Anti-Putin Protester Detained Again In Red Square

Performance artist Roman Roslovtsev returned to Red Square to stage his latest masked protest against Russian President Vladimir Putin and a law on public ga...

item.title: North Korea Sentences Korean-American to 10 Years in Prison
item.description:
North Korea Sentences Korean-American to 10 Years in Prison

Pyongyang has sentenced a Korean-American man to 10 years of hard labor for subversion. A North Korean court handed down the sentence Friday to naturalized U.S. citizen Kim Dong Chul. Kim confessed last month to attempting to steal North Korean military secrets and asked for mercy when he was paraded in front of the media in Pyongyang in March.

item.title: Syrian Army Planning Offensives on 2 IS Strongholds
item.description:
Syrian Army Planning Offensives on 2 IS Strongholds

The Syrian army has plans to launch offensive strikes on Deir Ez-Zor and Raqqa - two Islamic State strongholds in the country's northeast - with the help of Russian air forces, Alexei Borodavkin, Russia's ambassador to the United Nations in Geneva said Friday.

item.title: Future of Trauma Care May Be in a Backpack
item.description:
Future of Trauma Care May Be in a Backpack

In battlefield situations, taking even basic medical measurements may be complicated. Proper instruments, the knowledge of how to use them and good decision-making skills are required. It would be great if soldiers had sophisticated, miniaturized medical devices that could easily be used to help an injured person.

item.title: Speed Kills on South African Roads
item.description:
Speed Kills on South African Roads

Telephones ring and people cough inside a medical center here. The patients are waiting to see Dr. Wayne Korras. Few of his patients are aware of the general practitioner's history. As he examines their bodies, they know nothing about the map of scars spread across his chest and back.

item.title: US Teen Pregnancy Rates Plummet
item.description:
US Teen Pregnancy Rates Plummet

U.S. teen pregnancy rates have fallen nearly 50 percent among Hispanic and black teens, and the overall teen birth rate has dropped more than 40 percent in the past 10 years. One expert calls the new figures from the Centers for Disease Control, "One of the great success stories of the past two decades."
